For an average‐sized gene (22.5 kbp, based on log distribution, see below), our model estimates that this mutational rate would result in ≈0.9% of gene copies acquiring at least one sSNV by the age of 65 (Figure 1C). The model further predicts that longer genes are more likely to be affected by sSNVs. For instance, 65 years of the same mutational rate is expected to affect 60.5% of the copies of the longest human gene, CNTNAP2 (Figure 1C).
